feedbacks.bad: The grading scheme definitely (at least the mid sem scheme). Only 1 person got an A out of 60 people and C on av, B- on av+1. Ma'am also doesn't provide recorded lectures so there is that, even though instructions from AUGSD stated that it was compulsory.
feedbacks.good: The course was absolutely amazing. Even though Gender Studies is a meme (it was to me), Madhurima ma'am taught the course brilliantly. She made it interesting by showing many YouTube videos, documentaries, and things that were happening currently. Classes were very fun to attend and the course structure was very good too, will give you a new perspective on a lot of things. The assignments were well thought out also. All in all, a very interesting course, mostly because of how brilliantly Madhurima ma'am teaches
feedbacks.other: Attending the classes is a must if you want a good score but they are anyways interesting to attend. Make sure you pay attention to the readings regularly (West and Zimmerman, Talpade are the most important ones). Make decent class notes and revise them the day before the exam and you'll have no problem. Also, make sure you have Grammarly Pro for the assignments.

feedbacks.bad: Could have clarified the syllabus and pattern of evals a bit better, but other than that, nothing really.
feedbacks.good: Litest course ever and I don't think any course comes close, liter than TechRe, or even an SOP. There are two classes a week, and it doesn't matter if you attend them or not. The course is about the written part of advertising, the theory holds very little value. The group assignments are fun and actually test your creativity. Evals were so easy and generic that I regretted watching the lectures, I would have scored the same regardless of watching them.
feedbacks.other: Not really, there is no one way you can prepare for it, the only thing is when writing answers in evals where you have to think of ad campaigns, make sure you are consistent with your theme in slogan and the actual idea. That is the only criteria the prof cuts marks on. Don't diverge from the theme. Other than that, not much advise you can give.

feedbacks.good: Lite course but not lite grading.
feedbacks.bad: I was 10th in the class and still got B, so grading could have been better.
feedbacks.other: Watch movies, prepare points for tests beforehand.

feedbacks.good: Nothing after seeing the grades
feedbacks.bad: Everything
feedbacks.other: Be ready for almost the same marks for everyone, no feedback (online sem), extremely high av.

feedbacks.good: The course didn't require you to study. This is the only positive. C was given at av+12. That's worse than all CDCs this semester.
feedbacks.bad: Grading. Evals were fine and actually fun.
feedbacks.other:
1. Don't beat yourself up if you scored the average score in every question. He releases the average scores of only the individual questions btw. This average is calculated after filtering out all those who scored near 0 on the question. 
2. Avoid being generic

feedbacks.good: Course Structure Good.
feedbacks.bad: Grading very hard.
feedbacks.other: Don't.

feedbacks.good: Litest
feedbacks.bad: Grade Gap

feedbacks.good: None
feedbacks.bad: Everything But specifically course structures and instructions were extremely vague.
feedbacks.other: Almost same marks for everyone, extremely high avg, no feedback (online sem). Adaptation in "Cinematic Adaptation" was no where to be found.

feedbacks.good: Nothing to mug up for the course. Manoj sir is accommodative for genuine concerns(not kidding). He provides individual feedbacks for almost all evaluatives. More than academics it's a wonderful learning experience.
feedbacks.bad: Delay in giving marks. Also, he communicates the mode and structure of exams much late(atleast for the online sem).
feedbacks.other: Classes regular attend karo to nikal jayega course ache se

feedbacks.bad: Grading could have been lenient, considering that it is a 2 unit Huel.
feedbacks.good: Very lite course. The content is interesting and doesn't require much effort to understand. Could easily prepare for all Quizes and Compre in just a couple of hours before the exam.
feedbacks.other: Your creative writing sense would fetch you marks. No theory or book, just refer to the slides.

feedbacks.good: Instructor is brilliant

Course content was very interesting. Rajneesh sir listens to students' feedback. I had asked him to use slides since I was getting distracted easily in class using the anonymous feedback portal, and he adapted to it in the class which was within 6 hours of me submitting the feedback. Definitely do pick the course if you're interested in explaining people's behaviors. Btw, the compre was very enjoyable. I had never liked a compre as much as I liked this one. Also, even though the course had 4 assignments, they were the litest possible assignments. You just had to fill out a survey each time and you'd get a full score for submitting the survey. It is disappointing if you were looking to learn more, but it was a savior in the hectic semester.
feedbacks.bad: Evals were NOT meant to be MCQ. The compre was amazing. This will probably change with the T1 T2 T3 -> midsems change but yea. Assignments could have been actual assignments, but this change depends on what you define as better (experience vs liteness)
feedbacks.other: Attend lectures and chill there. It's basically just you listening to stories and their explanations. You could bunk them and still do well by just relying on your gut and the text book, but the lectures would definitely help a lot. p.s. If the midsem is a pure MCQ, search the text book as usually all the answers will be there nearly explicitly.

feedbacks.good: Excellent course. Passionate prof who cares for her students. I liked the content and the profs use of slides a lot. Evals were lite and attending lectures was like listening to a podcast.
feedbacks.bad: Perfection can't be improved

feedbacks.good: Not much prep needed, helps to attend all classes, but not necessary; for those who're interested in the topic its a perfect huel
Learnt things like resume writing, preparing for interviews, group discussions, and developing emotional intelligence. Extremely beneficial and insightfull.
feedbacks.bad: More practical exposure in some chapters, and more creative ways of evaluation.
feedbacks.other: Just attend classes, and take pictures of the slides. Exams just need a good understanding of the chapters and good writing skills.

feedbacks.good: Very lite and engaging course content. Classes were fun and weren't very heavy.
feedbacks.bad: Two assignments included creating a radio and TV ad (not of very long duration). Those were the only things which needed some time to make.
feedbacks.other: Just take pictures of the slides and give exams. Good writing skills can get you more marks.

feedbacks.good: The course was very chill and sir took into consideration what the students wanted. He even changed evaluatives according to students convenience.
feedbacks.bad: No.
feedbacks.other: Compre has greatest weightage so uspe efforts daal dena.

feedbacks.good: its a 1 day prep huel, just make sure you can put across your points effectively in Gds and presentations
feedbacks.bad: the structures were not given, if you hadnt attended class you couldve been fucked (happened to me in ompres, dropped from an A- to a B)
feedbacks.other: pehla 2 hafta class me participate karo debaes etc,maam ko naam malum pad gaya toh marks aa jayenge

feedbacks.good: Veena Ma'am is a dope instructor. Very understanding and calm. The course is also very interesting.
feedbacks.bad: Class Participation was very less. This course should be taken on-campus for best results.
feedbacks.other: The course is difficult but interesting. If you are interested in Politics, Philosophy or History, do take it. Varna lite.

feedbacks.good: Lite course. Don't need to study anything before the exam.
feedbacks.bad: The average is very high and the variance is very less.
feedbacks.other: Easy course hai. But boring hai.
All evaluatives have very small marks range so the grade totally depends on Compre. No need to attend lectures, very lite course. Av pe B, though difficult to score for A/A-

feedbacks.good: NOT APPLICABLE
feedbacks.bad: EVERYTHING
feedbacks.other: MAT LO PLS, PEHLE KUCH AUR OPTIONS RAKH LO.

Marks depend on the difference between your and sir's opinion. More dif= less marks. Av pe B, need to consistently score more to get A/A- as the marks range is very less. Evals are not factual news based and require your opinion. Lectures can be taken lite. Sir is very pro bjp

Marks depend on the difference between your and sir's opinion. More dif= less marks. Av pe B, need to consistently score more to get A/A- as the marks range is very less. Evals are not factual news based and require your opinion. Lectures can be taken lite. Sir is very pro bjp

feedbacks.good: Very lite, hardly need to devote much time for an A/A-.
feedbacks.bad: Course still teaches deprecated html4.
feedbacks.other: Take it, hard to find a huel which is more lite.

feedbacks.good: Won't get bored in the class.
feedbacks.other: Should do once in college.

feedbacks.bad: The content is too theoretical than it was expected by me. It seems the course structure has not been updated. Questions asked in exams were abstract to say the least, with no clear distinction as to what the examiner is asking for.
feedbacks.good: The course had some good takeaways in the end. Knowledge about creating websites, and basics of video editing seemed useful.
feedbacks.other: Make notes for his lectures either through his recordings or slides. Make sure you don't copy exactly what is written in the slides while attempting exams. Prolong that information.
Scam ho gaya hai grading mei.. Av + 12 pe C :')
Grading in pava- not lite anymore:')

feedbacks.good: Somewhat engaging assignments and trying to be updated, classes could be interactive and open for discussion.
feedbacks.bad:
GRADING !!!
Fair Marking Schemes
Non-biased decisions
And use real cases not ambiguous
feedbacks.other: While most of the huels turned out to be scams in the online semester, PAVA was also a big one. The course is a little bit interesting but poor assessment and terrible grading, if I knew this was gonna happen I wouldn't have taken it at all.

feedbacks.good: This course was the best decision I ever made. Such engaging and interesting lectures. Lots of food for thought, whether atheist or not. Manoj kannan sir at his best.
feedbacks.bad: There was a significant delay in giving marks for all evaluatives, although not much big of a deal. Sometimes, Kannan expects answers aligning with thoughts shared in class alone, so remember to keep in mind the viewpoint
feedbacks.other: Attending classes regularly is a must. And making your own notes too. The course would become extremely difficult if you don't do so, and very easy to score if you follow. So stay engaged and cover up each topic regularly.

feedbacks.good:
IC is very very considerate and chill
Not much need to attend classes, but they are fun and engaging.
feedbacks.bad:
Grading is okayish
Course content is too little(only 2.5 chap in online sem) to learn about real environment issues
Marks in midsem, compre is very luck dependent, av is skyrocketing, loooong answers are required in compre
feedbacks.other: Good for andha lite course with okayish grading

feedbacks.good:
Popular belief is its very lite
Ma'am wants to help in doubt solving but is not able to do it efficiently
feedbacks.bad:
Moderately difficult course content
Very bad teaching
Average grading

feedbacks.good: The practical part had significant weightage, and will be helpful in scoring to those who have already been learning music.
feedbacks.bad: Becomes very boring in the middle time. The focus is on Indian music, so if you're interested to learn about that in some detail, then this is for you, otherwise not(I think)

feedbacks.good: Teacher sucks, she is lazy
feedbacks.bad: content delivery can be much better
feedbacks.other: Pure game of chance, don't take it only to write paper, take a huel SOP instead

feedbacks.good: The course was done really well and ma'am covered all concepts really well. The classes are really interactive and fun to attend.
feedbacks.bad: Maybe the number of evaluatives in the form of assignments could have been reduced a bit, but again it was a great way of learning.
feedbacks.other: Lelo yaar, SSP is a really lite course if you just attend the classes. Ma'am pe impression acchi ho toh marks easily mil jate hain, uske ke liye classes regularly jaana and do the assignments properly. Really helps in personality development.

feedbacks.good: The course really helps you to understand about the media scenario and contemporary ideas in the business like advertising, content design, web and document design, etc. It's a really lite yet informative course since you can relate the course content to everyday mass media around you.
feedbacks.bad: The grading is a bit strict in terms of the freeness of ideas allowed in your answers. Sir generally deducts marks heavily if your answer and interpretation of the question doesn't match his answer key. So tread carefully.
feedbacks.other: Lelo yadi kum padhke bhi huel phodna hai. A day of study before the exam from slides and lectures is more than sufficient. It helps if you have a creative mind and are good at drawing and designing (not much but yes thodi madad kr deta hai). Would recommend 9/10 to take this course.

feedbacks.good: Got B at av+1. Even in a hectic sem with other huels having multiple quiz/assignment we had only 3 tests and no extra quiz/assignment.
feedbacks.other: Make notes

feedbacks.good: You'll actually learn something in this course.
feedbacks.other: Attend all classes.

feedbacks.good: It's a package course- easy, interesting and scoring.
The course content was interesting.  If you attend the lectures, studying a day before exams will suffice. Lecture recordings were provided to us.
feedbacks.bad: Lecture slides should have been shared with us. When we asked them to share they asked us to refer to lecture recordings.
feedbacks.other: Assignments have a weightage of 30%, in which you have to prepare a radio and a television ad. So, to score well in them you need to be very creative and put in genuine efforts. For exams studying slides a day before is enough. While attending the lectures make sure that you are attentive because she calls out the name of a random person and asks questions.

feedbacks.bad: I didn't find the lectures very interesting. Also, instructions about the exams like the syllabus and the kind of questions expected in exams could have been explained better by the instructor. There is not any variation in the marks she gives. More or less, everyone receives the same marks. There used to be a difference of 2-3marks between the highest and average. I found the course a bit ambiguous.
feedbacks.other: So, at the beginning of the course, you have to select a movie on which 75% of the questions in the exam will be based upon. So, select that movie wisely. Consult people who have taken the course before. Also, in every question asked in the exam you have to analyze your movie based on the criterion mentioned in the question. So, interest in movies is not sufficient you must be good at analyzing them.

feedbacks.good: very friendly teacher and easy scoring subject.
feedbacks.other: She didn't even conduct assignments, and just increased weightage of Tests. Also she is student friendly. Another course of her's (Bits f214) is also a lite course.

feedbacks.good: Don't have to attend classes and on avg+5 you get B
feedbacks.other: You yourself won't attend classes after attending 3 classes so you'll be on your own. Read the textbook and google all the terms on slide and you are good to go

feedbacks.good: No effort needed. Just read slides
Easy course, self study, could be done 1 day before exam easily, interactive lectures.
feedbacks.bad: Google classroom could have been used for evaluation, current system was a bit inconvenient
feedbacks.other:
Read slides before exam, most questions are from slides and you will get an easy A/A-.
I just read slides 1 day before and expressed that in exam and got an A-.

feedbacks.good: The course is logical but the teacher is extremely boring.
feedbacks.other: The teacher is really boring but the course is not at all effort intensive. If you like math or logic, or are good at it, I suggest that you take this course.

feedbacks.good: The teacher is a gem and he makes even the most boring topics insightful and interesting.
feedbacks.bad: Probably better pace, this time sir rushed through the latter part of the course due to time constraints, that could have been better.
feedbacks.other: Yeah, if you are even a little bit interested in the history of Europe and dont mind extensive readings and writing, you must go for this course. Its going to be a really memorable experience. But do remember that the amount of effort this course demands is equivalent to your CDCs, so be cautious too and take it keeping in mind the time constraints.

feedbacks.good: Litest course I've taken so far under the litest prof ever.
feedbacks.bad: Grading is a bit ambiguous and highly subjective.
feedbacks.other: Lite course chahiye ho aur movies dekhne ka mann ho toh le lena, you'll like it.

feedbacks.good: Veena Ramachandran is very engaging and very informative. Must take if interested in UPSC or hard core humanities in general.
feedbacks.bad: Grading scheme is a bit too harsh.
feedbacks.other: Go through the course once before registration. If you dont find it interesting, dont take it because interest is very important for this course.

feedbacks.good:
A great course for people genuinely interested in Cinema and Literature and those who want to learn what goes behind-the-scenes and look at these works for more than just their plots.
Also KSB is one of the best professors I've studied under and he is really good to talk to also.
feedbacks.bad: The course requires a solid reading habit, we had to read 3 short stories, 1 drama and 1 short novel. Along with 4 films that we had to watch. Can be a bit time consuming.
feedbacks.other: The course demands some input from your end but if you're ready to give it then it can be a really great learning experience.

feedbacks.good: Course is extremely lite. Exam questions are very general and easy to crack even if you havent attended lectures and just gone through slides.
feedbacks.bad: Pushp Lata maam is a good instructor but at times stagnates the flow of the lecture which makes it boring.
feedbacks.other: A must if you want to learn the real science behind behaviour in cross cultural encounters, an important soft skill to have. There isnt much content in the lectures as such, but it will surely get you started.

feedbacks.good: Easy to prepare. Good for people who really want to improve soft skills.
feedbacks.bad: The course outcome could've been better.
feedbacks.other: Be extremely regular and attentive in class

feedbacks.good: No one knows what to do. Everyone is as clueless as the other person
feedbacks.bad: Course outcome should have been better. You come out just with average grades.
feedbacks.other: Course is more about writing creatively yet efficiently!

feedbacks.good: Very understanding and chill profe ssor, and simple course
feedbacks.bad: Grading was very harsh, B- at avg
feedbacks.other: Attending lectures and reading textbook is enough for any evaluative

feedbacks.good: Very simple and straightforward course, does not require much effort other than attending classes
feedbacks.bad: A practice problem sheet should be given after every chapter to better help students understand the chapter
feedbacks.other: Definitely recommend course if you have good PR ( 3rd slot or lower)
Easy A/A-, just do assignments without copying

feedbacks.good: Easy evaluation components. Not much preparation required.
feedbacks.bad: Grading
feedbacks.other: Slides OP

feedbacks.good: Easy evaluation components.
feedbacks.bad: Very outdated course. "Hamare zamane me" type vibes...
feedbacks.other: No need to attend classes. Don't copy paste slide content.

feedbacks.good: Very very lite course. 75% course to be asked from your choice of film and 25% from a pool of selected films by mam. No studying required for exams. Entire course is open laptop.
feedbacks.bad: No learning outcome. Course av is very high. All components have a high Av. Thus if you are a student who doesn't want to study in HuEl yet wants a decent grade, take it. BUT, if you are a student who is serious about an A, don't take it. Because 1-2 marks here and there and you could get a A- or B
feedbacks.other: Nothing in the course is about adaptation. It's just analysing characters and scenes in movies.

feedbacks.good: Overrated course, overhyped like hell. Take if you don't care about your grades falling.
feedbacks.bad: Everything could have been better. Av grade C and Av+10 still gets you B-, so no need to explain more
feedbacks.other: Boycott GSC and Sangeeta Sharma Courses for a good future.

feedbacks.good: All Lecture Slides and Videos were provided. Sir teaches properly
feedbacks.bad: The marking was very random at times
feedbacks.other: Luck based course, exam ke ek din pehle padke grade ajayega

feedbacks.good: Ma'am used a lot of methods to keep lectures engaging
feedbacks.bad: Lecture Recordings could have been provided
feedbacks.other: If you have the stamina to attend all lectures then go for it, you will get A. Questions were asked from slides/notes/lecture discussions only
